alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 12:32PM EST until December 21 at 11:54PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Sagadahoc, Androscoggin and Cumberland Counties. Androscoggin River At Gorham affecting Coos and Oxford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River near Auburn. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, In Auburn, water is up to the foundations of homes on Newbury Street. In Lewiston, flooding occurs on Lincoln Street and Tall Pines Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM EST Wednesday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 9.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
